lead_paragraph: On Jan. 5, 1914, Henry Ford, head of the Ford Motor Company, introduced a minimum wage scale of $5 per day, more than doubling the wages for most employees. He also offered profit sharing to employees who lived a clean lifestyle, reduced the daily worker's shift to eight hours from nine and declared that no employee would "be discharged except for proved unfaithfulness or irremediable inefficiency."

headline.main: Jan. 5, 1914 | Henry Ford Implements the $5-a-Day Wage
